snippet: A suicide bomber on Saturday struck a street popular with tourists, officials said. Tensions were already high in Turkey after two bombings in Ankara.
abstract: Suicide bomber kills four people, including two Americans, in bustling Istanbul commercial district; thirty-six are wounded; Turkey has seen uptick in violence as it contends with Kurdish insurgency and becomes increasingly involved in Syrian conflict.

byline.original: By SAFAK TIMUR and CEYLAN YEGINSU
byline.contributor: Safak Timur reported from Istanbul, and Ceylan Yeginsu from Canakkale, Turkey. Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: A suicide bomber on Saturday struck a street popular with tourists, officials said. Tensions were already high in Turkey after two bombings in Ankara.

headline.main: Istanbul Bombing Kills at Least 4 and Wounds Dozens
headline.print_headline: 2 Americans Are Among 4 Dead in Suicide Bombing in Istanbul
